Table.Description: Spider Water (See notes in Wode Encounters.txt)

A set of marbles are spilled on the ground. Each who sees them must make a DC 15 wis save, or feel compelled to count every single one of them. Anything that delays counting the marbles deals 1d4 psychic damage. Counting every marble uses up 1 point of movement.

The Somnilaith's Couch: A beautiful couch in the middle of the forest, sat in front of a bush formed into a table, set up with afternoon tea.
 DC 13 wis save or be forced to sleep until the next dawn. You awake with 10 temp HP.
The glade you're in does not seem to end. Figure out a way out, or spend 2 points of movement.

A petal of the Daffodil Prince lands on your head.
 - Everyone makes a DC 20 Char save. If everyone fails, you are all possessed by the urge to party for the rest of the day
 - You have -5 on all perception for the rest of the day, and end the day with 2 levels of exhaustion. However, you are also able to sleep through the night without interruption.

A yellow mist blocks your path. This mist is a cloud of Prince Mycolaith's spores. To avoid it you must choose to enter a different hex.
 - If you walk through the mist, you must make a DC 12 con save. On failure, you are infected with the Prince's spores. It will take high level magic to remove them.
 - The next time the players kill something, its corpse fills with the Prince's spores, creating a Rotbeast (MCDM 304). This player must also save against Forest Rot when this happens.
The air shimmers with the shards of a broken mind. If you enter it, you must roll on the long term madness table, but in return you learn something important.
Call of Luna, as you glimpse a daytime moon: DC 12 Chr save, or that night you cannot sleep, for the moon calls to you. You are unable to take a short or long rest.
Call of Prince Daffodil: DC 15 Chr save. You have disadvantage on your next navigation roll to move between hexes. If you fail, you end up in The Daffodil Prince's Eternal Festival

Aranolia's' Webs: Nearly invisible, nearly impossible to escape.
 - A large spider touched by The Summer, who puts on 'festivals' for her young by capturing travellers, and waiting for the beasts of The Wode to feast upon them.
 - DC 20 STR check to get out. This save can be rerolled 3 times a day.
 - There may be creative ways to get out.
 - If a combat encounter is rolled while the players are trapped, it happens while they are caught in the webs.
 - When this happens, the spider retracks most of her webs so that the attackers don't get caught as well, and so the players have a chance to escape. In this way, she puts on a 'play'.
